title: UKCRC Centre of Excellence in Diet and Physical Activity Public Health Research
abstractText:
CEDAR (Centre for Diet and Activity Research) is one of five Centres funded as part of the UKCRC Public Health Research: Centres of Excellence.


The partnering of the University of Cambridge, the University of East Anglia and the Medical Research Council promotes excellence in public health research, driven by the overall goal of developing effective interventions for changing diet and physical activity.

 

Website: www.cedar.iph.cam.ac.uk
impactText: Influence on policy during 2014 is reported under the relevant output category in this Researchfish submission. In more general terms, findings from CEDAR are relevant to many aspects of the physical, social and economic environment and findings will be of interest to a wide range of Government departments (transport, treasury, health, education etc), local government, industry, charities and NGOs. Agriculture, Food and Drink,Communities and Social Services/Policy,Education,Environment,Healthcare,Leisure Activities, including Sports, Recreation and Tourism,Government, Democracy and Justice,Transport Societal,Economic,Policy & public services
findingsText: The award represents consortium funding through UKCRC to establish a centre of excellence in public health research in order to build infrastructure, develop capacity and enhance the interface between research and public health policy and practice. The Centre for Diet and Activity Research (CEDAR) has been successfully established and the centre funding has been renewed for a further 5 years. Influence on policy during 2014 is reported under the relevant output category in this Researchfish submission. In more general terms, findings from CEDAR are relevant to many aspects of the physical, social and economic environment and findings will be of interest to a wide range of Government departments (transport, treasury, health, education etc), local government, industry, charities and NGOs. Agriculture, Food and Drink,Education,Environment,Healthcare,Transport
